title: Theology & John Vervaeke: Jesus' Parables, Disrupting the Frame, & De-Centering (Part 1)
description:
Those of you who have been following my podcast for a while know that I've been fascinated by the work of @John Vervaeke . John and I have had a couple public dialogues, and I've also done several lectures on the points of intersection between Vervaeke's work (and the broader insights of cognitive science) and Christian theology.
I thought I would do some shorter videos exploring some of those points of intersection. 
In this first video we'll discuss "Frame disruption," "de-centering," and Jesus' parables, and also re-contextualize words like "sin" and "repent" in hopes of better capturing their intended meaning. 

I welcome your observations, questions, and objections in the comments.
____________
About me:
Paul Anleitner holds degrees in history from the University of Michigan & a Master's in Christian Thought from Bethel Seminary (St. Paul, MN) where he graduated with highest honors.

He's taught theology, philosophy, and biblical studies courses for over a decade and is a pastor with 15 years of experience working in a variety of denominational contexts.
____________

For the Deep Talks: Exploring Theology & Meaning-Making audio podcast:
https://deeptalkstheologypodcast.podbean.com/

To support my channel and podcast:
https://www.patreon.com/deeptalkstheologypodcas


Connect with Paul Anleitner on Twitter at:
https://twitter.com/PaulAnleitner


For John Vervaeke's "Awakening from the Meaning Crisis" series:
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLND1JCRq8Vuh3f0P5qjrSdb5eC1ZfZwWJ
